content: They are still journalists with training, experience and knowledge. If they are finding it necessary to risk their cushy, well-compensated jobs it’s for a good reason. To silence them would be to diminish our ability to evaluate our politicians and vote rationally. Hide your head in the sand if you wish, but don’t shame those who aren’t as cowardly as you. In a free country it is everybody’s responsibility to discuss politics and try to become the most aware they can be of what is best for our country. Trying to suppress information and opinions of journalists is antithetical to a functioning democracy. Discussing whether a sportswriter, or anybody for that matter, has the “right” to discuss these important issues is missing the mark entirely. It is painfully obvious a journalist has not a right but a responsibility to report what they see and discuss potential implications: it’s their duty as an American. Lamenting the “end of stick to sports” is nauseating and infuriating, missing the mark entirely. Why not lament the end of “a full democracy” as the EIU reported last week? This piece is one-sided, idiotic and anti-American. It’s almost as bad as the piece that asshat Rany wrote saying we should have gone into some large scale ground war in Syria, ignoring the fact that we haven’t had anything close to a successful invasion of a soverign nation in our nation’s history. If I wanted right-wing lunatics I’d be on Breitbart. Either make a statement or “stick to sports”. Don’t drown out the voices of the righteous with your milquetoast waffling.
